ygData.subject: Re: Re: Lambent OPINIONS
ygData.msgSnippet: HARMONIC:  I am not for/against twinking.  I do it, ... OPERAMAN: I twink any younger bard I see who has a polite aire about him/her ... ME: Hear hear! I am
ygData.messageBody:
HARMONIC:> > I am not for/against twinking. I do it,
> > I've done it, it's happened to me, it's happened for me.
>
> > Harmonic.
>
OPERAMAN:> I twink any younger bard I see who has a polite aire about
him/her
> and a genuine love for the singing profession.

ME: Hear hear! I am of the same opinion as harmonic... not blatantly for it,
not blatantly against it - i've done it, it's happened to me, and it's
happened for me as well... I too, help out any younger bard I see in the
same manner as Operaman...

OPERAMAN: > As for Lambent, I'll get it when the time is right, but have no
plans to
> even go for a bracer for a few levels. Bronze been berry berry good to me.

ME: Me too - no plans to go for anything for probably 8-10 levels.... but I
did switch bronze shoulders for bloodstained mantle.... lighter and nicer
for me. Small bronze greaves, banded boots, still have leather (or is it
rawhide?) on the upper arm... but I have had, since L5, Dwarven Ringmail
Tunic, which an unknown someone gave me. It has served me well and will
continue to serve for a while.... It also helps having and enchanting
husband who is also a jeweler - who makes me all sorts of wonderful,
stat-buffing items - functional, practical, AND beautiful (what woman
doesn't want jewelry - even if it is for her EQ character...) *grin*

Brangwen Incantare
L20 - well on her way to 21!
